item.description:
We'll meet at Cider Hill Farm at noon.  I'll have a sign "Old Ladies Travel"  Then we'll pick fruit for awhile.  Right now, according to their website apples, peaches and a few raspberries are ripe for picking.  Cider Hill provides containers for us and also a picking guide so we know what's ripe.  They charge by the pound (but I don't know how much per pound).

I'm making a reservation at the Amesbury Flatbread Company for a late lunch.  They use produce from Cider Hill.  They have all types of flatbread pizza, salads and desserts.

FYI: Cider Hill also has honey bees on the farm so if anyone has an allergy come prepared just in case.

Send me any questions you may have and I'll see you on Saturday!
item.how_to_find_us: I'll have an "Old Ladies Travel" sign and you can call me at 617 899-0740 if lost

group.name: Old and Not so Old Ladies Travel

item.name: Pick your own fruit at Cider Hill Farm and early dinner/late lunch after
